course_description: Introduction to the theory of markets, including consumer and producer choice and how they interact to determine prices and resource allocations. Applications include price controls, production, market structures, environmental economics, governmental regulation of the economy, labor and capital markets, and international exchange.
sections: Class Nbr: 1282, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MWF 10:30-11:30a, Instructor: K. Chakraborty, Status: Open
